author: chris2_2_2
content: Agree with this. Current usage is probably a fraction of a fraction of what the final testnet will get though. Hopefully there is one major final merge testnet and if there is a bug it just repeats until there aren’t any bugs.

author: timbeiko
content: Yes, we plan to do at least one more major testnet before we schedule the existing ones like Goerli, Ropsten, etc. to fork. Obviously, any major bug we find means we’ll pause and re-evaluate

author: killari.
content: I think we get the best test coverage by merging all the existing testnets and let people to continue to use them. Its also educational for the users as they then go through the merge before it happens on mainnet

author: killari.
content: I guess there could be blogposts talking about what users (dapp developers, network users, node runners,..) should do

author: diegolosada
content: Hi!. I can't get Lighthouse to parse the new` boot_enr.yaml ` file (it works with the old one which was only one line). Could anybody confirm? <@!199561711278227457>?

author: yorickdowne
content: I am going to run a training program(me) for Chainlink node operators after ETHDenver. I think I'd like to run it on Sepolia, as that's the "new hotness long-running testnet". Do you have any word from the etherscan crew on whether they are already planning for sepolia.etherscan.io, and maybe even a rough ETA?
